commits.author: Claudia
commits.summary: Fix Ruby 2.6 ERB trim mode warning
commits.body:
This commit fixes an incompatibility introduced by Ruby 2.6 in the
ERB class, which deprecates certain combinations of trim mode
specifiers, such as `%-<>`. [1] [2]

This causes TextMate’s Bundle Support library (which uses the `%-<>`
trim mode specifier [3]) to print a warning when run via Ruby 2.6.

The workaround proposed here is to use the `ruby20` shim, which
points to system Ruby 2.3 as of macOS 10.14. That’s how other
TextMate bundles do it if they depend on some post-1.8 feature
(such as `json`) but still need some legacy behavior. [4]

Future macOS versions may re-introduce this issue if they come with
Ruby 2.6 or later. That will also affect other TextMate bundles. [4]
In that case, we’re going to need alternative fixes, for example
vendoring a pure-Ruby JSON library [5] or even vendoring Ruby itself
(like TextMate does with Ruby 1.8 today).

[1] https://redmine.ruby-lang.org/attachments/7457

[2] https://redmine.ruby-lang.org/issues/15294

[3] https://github.com/textmate/bundle-support.tmbundle/blob/39042ef25cc5603054eee11f27c2ea91d54a6cdf/Support/shared/lib/tm/htmloutput.rb#L91

[4] https://github.com/search?q=org%3Atextmate+ruby20&type=Code

[5] https://github.com/textmate/sql.tmbundle/blob/6d4edbc113d3272f7c097d6b1504624289ee2bc5/Support/lib/json.rb

commits.author: Rob Tsuk
commits.body:
The Fuchsia build environment produces Cargo.toml
files with lots of patch statements that aren’t used
by every crate. This change supresses those patch warnings
as they push the actual warnings/errors one cares about
low enough that one has to scroll to see them.

commits.author: Rob Tsuk
commits.summary: Made the error code link to the Rust Compiler Error Index
commits.body:
The descriptions at the Rust Compiler Error Index are often very helpful so
make the bundle convert the E-codes to a clickable link.
